shinysurveyjs 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Create Single Survey

survey_single.Rd

Creates a Shiny application for a single survey with database integration. Responses are stored in a PostgreSQL database with configurable table name.

Usage

survey_single(
  json,
  show_response = TRUE,
  theme = "defaultV2",
  theme_color = "#003594",
  theme_mode = "light",
  shiny_config = list(host = "0.0.0.0", port = 3838),
  db_config = list(host = Sys.getenv("HOST"), port = as.numeric(Sys.getenv("PORT")),
    db_name = Sys.getenv("DB_NAME"), user = Sys.getenv("USER"), password =
    Sys.getenv("PASSWORD"), write_table = Sys.getenv("WRITE_TABLE"), log_table =
    Sys.getenv("LOG_TABLE")),
  cookie_expiration_days = 7
)

Arguments

json

Survey JSON string or object defining the survey structure

show_response

Logical. Whether to show responses after submission (default: TRUE)

theme

Theme name for SurveyJS: "defaultV2" or "modern" (default: "defaultV2")

theme_color

Primary color hex code for theme customization

theme_mode

Color mode selection: "light" or "dark" (default: "light")

shiny_config

Optional list. Shiny configuration parameters passed to configure_shiny()

db_config

List. Database connection parameters (defaults to environment variables):

  • host: Database host (default: HOST environment variable)

  • port: Database port (default: PORT environment variable)

  • db_name: Database name (default: DB_NAME environment variable)

  • user: Database username (default: USER environment variable)

  • password: Database password (default: PASSWORD environment variable)

  • write_table: Table name to write survey data (default: WRITE_TABLE environment variable)

  • log_table: Table name to write log messages (default: LOG_TABLE environment variable)

Value

A Shiny application object
